In much the same way, what goes on inside of us is like the roots of a tree.

authorOccupation: Computer programmer, Internet entrepreneur, co-founder of Facebook

authorOccupation: Computer programmer, Internet entrepreneur, co-founder of Facebook

author: Maya Angelou

content: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.

author: Maya Angelou
content: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.

author: Maya Angelou
content: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.

author: Maya Angelou
content: When someone shows you who they are, believe them the first time.

author: Maya Angelou
content: Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness.

author: Maya Angelou

content: It's one of the greatest gifts you can give yourself, to forgive. Forgive everybody.

content: My mother said I must always be intolerant of ignorance but understanding of illiteracy. That some people, unable to go to school, were more educated and more intelligent than college professors.

author: Maya Angelou
content: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.

author: Maya Angelou
content: I work very hard, and I play very hard. I'm grateful for life. And I live it - I believe life loves the liver of it. I live it.

content: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.

content: Courage is the most important of all the virtues, because without courage you can't practice any other virtue consistently. You can practice any virtue erratically, but nothing consistently without courage.

content: I'm grateful to intelligent people. That doesn't mean educated. That doesn't mean intellectual. I mean really intelligent. What black old people used to call 'mother wit' means intelligence that you had in your mother's womb. That's what you rely on. You know what's right to do.

No, we're all in this together. We always have been.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: America is hope. It is compassion. It is excellence. It is valor.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: We are a continuum. Just as we reach back to our ancestors for our fundamental values, so we, as guardians of that legacy, must reach ahead to our children and their children. And we do so with a sense of sacredness in that reaching.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: Journey with me to a true commitment to our environment. Journey with me to the serenity of leaving to our children a planet in equilibrium.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: I am an American. I love this country.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: No one on his deathbed ever said, I wish I had spent more time on my business.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: Let's try winning and see what it feels like. If we don't like it, we can go back to our traditions.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: This land, this water, this air, this planet - this is our legacy to our young.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: Our only weapons in this war of your lifetime are the weapons of the mind.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: You are part of that horrid expression, the best and the brightest. It can be a terrible burden if you let it be, but it is the great challenge of your time. And being a warrior in that challenge should be wondrous.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: No one is immune from the larger events of his or her time - the Depression, World War II, civil rights, Vietnam, the spring of 1989 in China. These events intrude upon our lives and radically affect our directions.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: A commencement is a time of joy. It is also a time of melancholy. But then again, so is life.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: I want to deploy the leadership to meet the challenges that face us and to restore America's greatness.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: Don't fear your mortality, because it is this very mortality that gives meaning and depth and poignancy to all the days that will be granted to you.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: That's a good question. Let me try to evade you.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: When George Bush used the Willie Horton ad, he knew what he was doing.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: I have pretty much made up my mind to do this.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: Two hundred years ago, our Founding Fathers gave us a democracy. It was based upon the simple, yet noble, idea that government derives its validity from the consent of the governed.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: You are Americans. You love this country. Together we are entrusted with the principles that represent mankind's greatest political and social achievement.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: Our destiny is greatness and we must return to its fulfillment.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: Thinking in generations also means enabling our young to have a decent standard of living.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: That sense of sacredness, that thinking in generations, must begin with reverence for this earth.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: From a viable economy to the full funding of Headstart, from a clean environment to true equality for women, from a strong military to a commitment to racial brotherhood, from schools that are honored to streets free of excessive violence.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: Seven and half years ago I began my own journey. For me and my family it was a time of adversity. But during that adversity I derived a deeper faith. And born out of that adversity was a commitment to devote myself to those people and to those issues that truly matter to me.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: America is the sum of all our journeys as we search for our national community and our national culture.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: In this era of the global village, the tide of democracy is running. And it will not cease, not in China, not in South Africa, not in any corner of this earth, where the simple idea of democracy and freedom has taken root.

author: Paul Tsongas
content: It was a myth that's often perpetuated at commencement that holds that only hope and promise lie beyond the halls of academe. Don't worry, be happy. Everything is fine.

author: Paul Walker
content: Sometimes the hurdles aren't really hurdles at all. They're welcome challenges, tests.

author: Paul Walker
content: My philosophy is: If you can't have fun, there's no sense in doing it.

author: Paul Walker
content: I live by 'Go big or go home.' That's with everything. It's like either commit and go for it or don't do it at all. I apply that to everything. I apply that to relationships, I apply that to like sports, I apply that to everything. That's what I live by. That's how I like it.

author: Paul Walker
content: Surfing big waves is not an extreme sport to me. I fall off, tumble down, and come up. My heart's racing because I'm thinking I almost drowned, and I thank God I can breathe again, but I always think, 'What am I hitting?' Water.

author: Paul Walker
content: Surfing soothes me, it's always been a kind of Zen experience for me. The ocean is so magnificent, peaceful, and awesome. The rest of the world disappears for me when I'm on a wave.

author: Paul Walker
content: I think my mom put it best. She said, 'Little girls soften their daddy's hearts.'

author: Paul Walker
content: I'm not afraid of anything. That's just the way I am.

author: Paul Walker
content: Thing is, I went to a born-again Christian high school, was brought up in a traditional Mormon family where these ideas about parenting are of structure and sacrifice. To think outside of that idea of family and parenting that I've grown up with is tough but also very freeing.

author: Paul Walker
content: It's not about working anymore, its about doing work I can be proud of.

author: Paul Walker
content: If you spend any time with a man, you'll realize that we're all still little boys.

author: Paul Walker
content: I don't care what it is in life: listen to your heart. If you do, no matter what, you win.

author: Paul Walker
content: My mom's hot. I mean she's old, but my mom's out of control.

author: Paul Walker
content: I have an airplane hangar with 17 cars in it. That's no joke. I have a 'half pipe' in there, too - you know, like a big ramp, where I skateboard. It's awesome. It's the ultimate fantasy.

author: Paul Walker
content: There's a lot of guys that just get comfortable with their positions and rest on their laurels. I had to earn my way.

author: Paul Walker
content: I remember when I first came around, the computer-generated stuff was pretty wicked. I was like, 'Wow!' but I feel like then for the longest time, we saw so much of it, after a while, you might as well just be watching an animated movie.

author: Paul Walker
content: I almost sabotaged my career. 'The Fast and the Furious' didn't let me, and I'm grateful now. That franchise gave me the opportunity.

author: Paul Walker
content: In college, my friends called me Mr. James Bond 007 because I entertained everything: blonds, brunettes, redheads. I'm across the board.

author: Paul Walker
content: You know, all that really matters is that the people you love are happy and healthy. Everything else is just sprinkles on the sundae.

author: Paul Walker
content: The dream is to have it all. Who says you can't have your cake and eat it too? Live this life, that life, this life, you know? You only live one time - I want to get it all in.

author: Paul Walker
content: I've always wanted to race cars, ever since I was a young boy, as I think a lot of guys have.

author: Paul Walker
content: I'm a crazy car guy. I've got an airplane hangar full of cars.

author: Paul Walker
content: Attitude is attitude, whether you're a West Coast gangster or East Coast gangster, you know?

author: Paul Walker
content: When I was younger, the pressure was just being cool. I never thought of myself as a cool guy. I always thought of myself as more of the goofy guy.

author: Paul Walker
content: I'm a science guy. I'm a geek. I love geology and botany and marine science. I thought maybe I'd be a professional guide, or maybe even a park ranger, working for the Department of Fish and Game.

author: Paul Walker
content: I wish I could be behind the wheel for every stunt.

author: Paul Walker
content: I'm a doer, and whether it was the tsunami in Sri Lanka or the earthquake in Indonesia, I was always saying, 'I should be there; I should be helping out.'

author: Paulo Coelho
content: I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Life was always a matter of waiting for the right moment to act.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Culture makes people understand each other better. And if they understand each other better in their soul, it is easier to overcome the economic and political barriers. But first they have to understand that their neighbour is, in the end, just like them, with the same problems, the same questions.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: I can control my destiny, but not my fate. Destiny means there are opportunities to turn right or left, but fate is a one-way street. I believe we all have the choice as to whether we fulfil our destiny, but our fate is sealed.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: No one can lie, no one can hide anything, when he looks directly into someone's eyes.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Waiting is painful. Forgetting is painful. But not knowing which to do is the worse kind of suffering.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: When you are enthusiastic about what you do, you feel this positive energy. It's very simple.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Remember your dreams and fight for them. You must know what you want from life. There is just one thing that makes your dream become impossible: the fear of failure.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: You drown not by falling into a river, but by staying submerged in it.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Love is a trap. When it appears, we see only its light, not its shadows.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: The good old days, when each idea had an owner, are gone forever.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: I cry very easily. It can be a movie, a phone conversation, a sunset - tears are words waiting to be written.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: You have to take risks. We will only understand the miracle of life fully when we allow the unexpected to happen.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: You can become blind by seeing each day as a similar one. Each day is a different one, each day brings a miracle of its own. It's just a matter of paying attention to this miracle.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: I write from my soul. This is the reason that critics don't hurt me, because it is me. If it was not me, if I was pretending to be someone else, then this could unbalance my world, but I know who I am.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Let us be absolutely clear about one thing: we must not confuse humility with false modesty or servility.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: The wise are wise only because they love. The fool are fools only because they think they can understand love.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Writing means sharing. It's part of the human condition to want to share things - thoughts, ideas, opinions.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Tell your heart that the fear of suffering is worse than the suffering itself. And no heart has ever suffered when it goes in search of its dream.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: Everything that happens once can never happen again. But everything that happens twice will surely happen a third time.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: No, I never saw an angel, but it is irrelevant whether I saw one or not. I feel their presence around me.

author: Paulo Coelho
content: When a person really desires something, all the universe conspires to help that person to realize his dream.

author: Pele
content: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.

author: Pele
content: I always had a philosophy which I got from my father. He used to say, 'Listen. God gave to you the gift to play football. This is your gift from God. If you take care of your health, if you are in good shape all the time, with your gift from God no one will stop you, but you must be prepared.'

author: Pele
content: I am constantly being asked about individuals. The only way to win is as a team. Football is not about one or two or three star players.

author: Pele
content: Enthusiasm is everything. It must be taut and vibrating like a guitar string.

author: Pele
content: Everything is practice.

author: Pele
content: Brazil eats, sleeps and drinks football. It lives football!

author: Pele
content: I have to trust something that gives me power; I have to believe in something, but in my career I have a lot of moments I cannot explain with God.

author: Pele
content: The level of football in England is the top. English football is the leader in the world.

author: Pele
content: When I was a footballer, I surrounded myself with footballers. We were all friends. But in Brasilia you don't know who your friends are. It can be a dangerous place.

author: Pele
content: The first World Cup I remember was in the 1950 when I was 9 or 10 years old. My father was a soccer player, and there was a big party, and when Brazil lost to Uruguay, I saw my father crying.

author: Pele
content: The World Cup is a very complicated tournament - six games, seven if you make it to the final - and maybe if you lose one game you're out, even if you're the best.

author: Pele
content: Yes, I have a lot of business interests. But I don't work for just anyone, and I choose the companies very carefully.

author: Pele
content: The World Cup is a very important way to measure the good players, and the great ones. It is a test of a great player.

author: Pele
content: The bicycle kick is not easy to do. I scored 1,283 goals, and only two or three were bicycle kicks.

author: Pele
content: When I retired, at that time I had a lot of proposals to play in Europe, England, Italy, Spain, Mexico. But I said no, after 18 years I want to rest, because I want to retire.

author: Pele
content: Sport is something that is very inspirational for young people.

author: Pele
content: Brazil's always had great players, both at home and abroad, but we need to put all that talent together and mould a team out of it.

author: Pele
content: A lot of people, when a guy scores a lot of goals, think, 'He's a great player', because a goal is very important, but a great player is a player who can do everything on the field. He can do assists, encourage his colleagues, give them confidence to go forward. It is someone who, when a team does not do well, becomes one of the leaders.

author: Pele
content: I represent Brazil all over the world. Wherever I go I have to do my best, to not disappoint the Brazilian people. And that I've done.

author: Pele
content: When you play against dirty players or very tough players, it's easy to escape because you know what they're going to do. But when the player is tough but intelligent, it's much more difficult.

author: Pele
content: I've come to accept that the life of a frontrunner is a hard one, that he will suffer more injuries than most men and that many of these injuries will not be accidental.

author: Pele
content: A penalty is a cowardly way to score.

author: Pele
content: Lionel Messi is a wonderful player. Very skillful. Highly intelligent. He is not good in the air.

author: Pele
content: If you don't give education to people, it is easy to manipulate them.

author: Pele
content: Everybody knows my life. I won a lot of tournaments and scored more than 1,000 goals, won three World Cups but I could not play in Olympic Games.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Memorial Day isn't just about honoring veterans, its honoring those who lost their lives. Veterans had the fortune of coming home. For us, that's a reminder of when we come home we still have a responsibility to serve. It's a continuation of service that honors our country and those who fell defending it.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: At Concerned Veterans for America, we've made the case that the defense budget could be targeted for spending reform, but in a targeted fashion that genuinely changes unsustainable spending trajectories while preserving U.S. defense capacity.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: As an infantry officer who served in Iraq, Afghanistan, and Guantanamo Bay, I have led men in combat and trained them on tactics and strategy. The mission of the infantry is to 'close with, and destroy, the enemy.' Our job, in a direct way, is to fight and win wars.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: The historic nature of Israel's struggle for self-determination, freedom, and prosperity underscores the gravity of their circumstances and fortifies my commitment to America's responsibility as their ally.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Veterans are driven by the same frustrations that the public has with what is happening in Washington... the fiscal irresponsibility and the financial crisis that our country is facing.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: President Lincoln chose to fight a bloody and unpopular war because he believed the enemy had to be defeated. He was right.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Concerned Veterans for America (CVA) has called for an audit of the Pentagon, so that we finally have some transparency and accountability in how DOD spends taxpayer dollars.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: As an observer, I react to the realities of Israeli life with both envy and relief. Nobody wants to live under the threat of constant attack from enemies right next door, under ceaseless and often unfair international scrutiny, defending his homeland by day and living with the memories of mass genocide at night.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: The choices Israelis face and the decisions they make, day in and day out, are literally the difference between life and death. In many ways, I liken their reactions to the way I felt while serving in Iraq.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Peace through strength works; but the flip side is war invited by weakness.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: I believe, if done correctly, eliminating Saddam and liberating Iraq could be the 'Normandy Invasion' or 'fall of the Berlin Wall' of our generation... the Iraqi people are eager to be rid of Saddam, and there is equally encouraging evidence that republican principles could thrive there.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: In the 360-degree battlefields of Iraq and Afghanistan, women have served honorably and fought valiantly. Yet there is a key difference between being in harm's way and reacting to enemy contact, and being in a direct combat operations role day in and day out. They are different scenarios that require different standards.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Defense leaders should be searching for ways to reform out-of-date procurement processes, to collapse layers of Pentagon bureaucracy, and to restrain the growth in personnel and benefits costs. A critical first step in that process should be to conduct a full Pentagon audit to determine how DOD spends taxpayer dollars.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: With the winding down of the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan, the United States now has an opportunity to implement real defense reforms without having a serious impact on immediate battlefield needs.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Military deployments have never been something to enjoy, but the consequence of the actions, the shared nature of the sacrifices, and the nobility of the cause are invigorating. To be clear, I'm not talking about the killing and the death; rather, the sense of purpose that pervades every action, reaction, and outcome.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: As the publisher of the 'Tory,' I strive to defend the pillars of Western civilization against the distractions of diversity.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Being a defense hawk and a budget hawk are not mutually exclusive.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Political correctness is a poison to our security and defenses. It imposes a willful blindness, both at the macro level when unwilling to engage with radical Islamism or whatever you want to call it - if you're not willing to call it what it is - and at the micro level, at the street level.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: I think standing and fighting and working alongside all of these people that raise their right hand and serve their nation... really wipes away the distractions of some of the petty things we think are important at home.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: When Mr. Obama entered office, he said all the right things about getting Washington spending under control. He even promised to cut the deficit in half by the end of his first term. Obviously, that didn't happen.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: It's a sense in Minnesota that we need to get back to common sense. We need to get back to taking sensible looks at positions and understanding the proper role of government.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Combat duty is strenuous and physically demanding, and I'm not the first person to notice that men and women are built differently. And while many will argue that women will only be allowed into combat arms units under the same requirements as their male counterparts, count me as skeptical.

author: Pete Hegseth
content: Whether we like it or not, gender differences matter in a combat situation.

author: Peter Drucker
content: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.

author: Peter Drucker
content: The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.

author: Peter Drucker
content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

author: Peter Drucker

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: I know of no single formula for success. But over the years I have observed that some attributes of leadership are universal and are often about finding ways of encouraging people to combine their efforts, their talents, their insights, their enthusiasm and their inspiration to work together.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: At its heart, engineering is about using science to find creative, practical solutions. It is a noble profession.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: Grief is the price we pay for love.

author: Queen Elizabeth II

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: The lessons from the peace process are clear; whatever life throws at us, our individual responses will be all the stronger for working together and sharing the load.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: I have in sincerity pledged myself to your service, as so many of you are pledged to mine. Throughout all my life and with all my heart I shall strive to be worthy of your trust.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: I cannot lead you into battle. I do not give you laws or administer justice but I can do something else - I can give my heart and my devotion to these old islands and to all the peoples of our brotherhood of nations.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: The upward course of a nation's history is due in the long run to the soundness of heart of its average men and women.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: To all those who have suffered as a consequence of our troubled past I extend my sincere thoughts and deep sympathy. With the benefit of historical hindsight we can all see things which we would wish had been done differently or not at all.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: It's all to do with the training: you can do a lot if you're properly trained.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: I declare before you all that my whole life, whether it be long or short, shall be devoted to your service and the service of our great imperial family to which we all belong.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: First, I want to pay tribute to Diana myself. She was an exceptional and gifted human being. In good times and bad, she never lost her capacity to smile and laugh, nor to inspire others with her warmth and kindness. I admired and respected her - for her energy and commitment to others, and especially for her devotion to her two boys.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: It is easy enough to define what the Commonwealth is not. Indeed this is quite a popular pastime.

author: Queen Elizabeth II

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: To what greater inspiration and counsel can we turn than to the imperishable truth to be found in this treasure house, the Bible?

author: Queen Elizabeth II

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: In remembering the appalling suffering of war on both sides, we recognise how precious is the peace we have built in Europe since 1945.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: Madam President, speaking here in Dublin Castle it is impossible to ignore the weight of history, as it was yesterday when you and I laid wreaths at the Garden of Remembrance.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: The events that I have attended to mark my Diamond Jubilee have been a humbling experience. It has touched me deeply to see so many thousands of families, neighbors and friends celebrating together in such a happy atmosphere.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: At Christmas, I am always struck by how the spirit of togetherness lies also at the heart of the Christmas story. A young mother and a dutiful father with their baby were joined by poor shepherds and visitors from afar. They came with their gifts to worship the Christ child.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: My husband has quite simply been my strength and stay all these years, and I owe him a debt greater than he would ever claim.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: I have been aware all the time that my peoples, spread far and wide throughout every continent and ocean in the world, were united to support me in the task to which I have now been dedicated with such solemnity.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: I have to be seen to be believed.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: For many, Christmas is also a time for coming together. But for others, service will come first.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
content: I myself prefer my New Zealand eggs for breakfast.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller

author: Ray Bradbury
content: Science fiction is any idea that occurs in the head and doesn't exist yet, but soon will, and will change everything for everybody, and nothing will ever be the same again. As soon as you have an idea that changes some small part of the world you are writing science fiction. It is always the art of the possible, never the impossible.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: I hate all politics. I don't like either political party. One should not belong to them - one should be an individual, standing in the middle. Anyone that belongs to a party stops thinking.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you.

author: Ray Bradbury

author: Ray Bradbury

author: Ray Bradbury
content: In my later years, I have looked in the mirror each day and found a happy person staring back. Occasionally I wonder why I can be so happy. The answer is that every day of my life I've worked only for myself and for the joy that comes from writing and creating. The image in my mirror is not optimistic, but the result of optimal behavior.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: The great fun in my life has been getting up every morning and rushing to the typewriter because some new idea has hit me.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: When you're older you want to learn from other people.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: I discovered me in the library. I went to find me in the library.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: We are an impossibility in an impossible universe.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: Love. Fall in love and stay in love. Write only what you love, and love what you write. The key word is love. You have to get up in the morning and write something you love, something to live for.

author: Ray Bradbury
content: If God treats you well by teaching you a disastrous lesson, you never forget it.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: As a general rule, if you are prone to melodramatic meltdowns, please avoid purchasing a webcam for any reason.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: I was influenced by a lot of stand-up comedians... Eddie Murphy back when he was doing 'Raw.' I watched that so many times as a kid, I can probably still quote the entire thing to this day. Chris Rock. Dave Chappelle. George Carlin. A lot of the guys who were sort of edgy for their time.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: My success has been something I've worked a long time at and it's been a gradual process. I compare it to the idea of someone losing a lot of weight over a period of a few years. You don't really notice the weight loss overall but if you compare photos from then and now there's a big difference.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: Maybe someday, if I work hard enough, entertainment will be a career for me, but right now making videos and uploading them to the Internet is just a hobby.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: Never angrily rant into your web cam. While smashing a keyboard in half over a game of 'World of Warcraft' may seem totally justified in your head, to the rest of the known universe you look like a raging psychopath.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: One of the amazing things about the Internet is that the content creators are the gatekeepers. We can think of an idea and execute it quickly, and we didn't have to pitch the idea to a major network or convince a studio head to sign-off on the concept.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: I not only hope that YouTube channels compete with television shows for viewers and revenue, I hope they develop a bitter rivalry which could only be settled by an elaborate medieval tournament where the two entities fight to the death in a steel cage.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: At the end of the day, a television, a computer, or a smart phone is just a device through which one can access content. The content itself is what matters, not the device.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: What really shocks me, what I can honestly sit back and ponder for hours in a lot of cases is just, 'Why would you film yourself doing that? Who put you up to that? What are you getting out of that?'

author: Ray William Johnson

content: I'm motivated by entertaining people.

author: Ray William Johnson

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: In fall 2007, I stood at the midway point of completing my undergraduate studies at Columbia. I studied every moment that I wasn't sitting in class. I was very focused on maintaining a solid GPA, so I could go on to law school.

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: During my long study sessions in the library, I found myself watching YouTube videos during study breaks.

author: Ray William Johnson

author: Ray William Johnson
authorOccupation: Actor, comedian, producer, writer, director, rapper, singer, songwriter
content: I run advertisements and sell T-shirts to cover overhead costs and pay the few people who help me out behind the scenes. Anything left over is spent on production costs, animation costs, etc.

content: I was born not knowing and have had only a little time to change that here and there.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: Scientific views end in awe and mystery, lost at the edge in uncertainty, but they appear to be so deep and so impressive that the theory that it is all arranged as a stage for God to watch man's struggle for good and evil seems inadequate.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: The internal machinery of life, the chemistry of the parts, is something beautiful. And it turns out that all life is interconnected with all other life.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: If I could explain it to the average person, I wouldn't have been worth the Nobel Prize.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: The thing that doesn't fit is the thing that's the most interesting: the part that doesn't go according to what you expected.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: Once I get on a puzzle, I can't get off.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: What one fool can understand, another can.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: Nature uses only the longest threads to weave her patterns, so that each small piece of her fabric reveals the organization of the entire tapestry.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: It's the way I study - to understand something by trying to work it out or, in other words, to understand something by creating it. Not creating it one hundred percent, of course; but taking a hint as to which direction to go but not remembering the details. These you work out for yourself.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: From the point of view of basic physics, the most interesting phenomena are, of course, in the new places, the places where the rules do not work - not the places where they do work! That is the way in which we discover new rules.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: If I get stuck, I look at a book that tells me how someone else did it. I turn the pages, and then I say, 'Oh, I forgot that bit,' then close the book and carry on. Finally, after you've figured out how to do it, you read how they did it and find out how dumb your solution is and how much more clever and efficient theirs is!

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: Reality must take precedence over public relations, for nature cannot be fooled.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: Poets say science takes away from the beauty of the stars - mere globs of gas atoms. I, too, can see the stars on a desert night, and feel them. But do I see less or more?

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: Until I began to learn to draw, I was never much interested in looking at art.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: It is necessary to look at the results of observation objectively, because you, the experimenter, might like one result better than another.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: The fact that the colors in the flower have evolved in order to attract insects to pollinate it is interesting; that means insects can see the colors. That adds a question: does this aesthetic sense we have also exist in lower forms of life?

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: See that the imagination of nature is far, far greater than the imagination of man.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: We are at the very beginning of time for the human race. It is not unreasonable that we grapple with problems. But there are tens of thousands of years in the future. Our responsibility is to do what we can, learn what we can, improve the solutions, and pass them on.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: Things on a very small scale behave like nothing that you have any direct experience about. They do not behave like waves, they do not behave like particles, they do not behave like clouds, or billiard balls, or weights on springs, or like anything that you have ever seen.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: I think that when we know that we actually do live in uncertainty, then we ought to admit it; it is of great value to realize that we do not know the answers to different questions. This attitude of mind - this attitude of uncertainty - is vital to the scientist, and it is this attitude of mind which the student must first acquire.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: I don't know what's the matter with people: they don't learn by understanding; they learn by some other way - by rote, or something. Their knowledge is so fragile!

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: The idea is to try to give all the information to help others to judge the value of your contribution; not just the information that leads to judgment in one particular direction or another.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: It is in the admission of ignorance and the admission of uncertainty that there is a hope for the continuous motion of human beings in some direction that doesn't get confined, permanently blocked, as it has so many times before in various periods in the history of man.

author: Richard P. Feynman
content: If we have an atom that is in an excited state and so is going to emit a photon, we cannot say when it will emit the photon. It has a certain amplitude to emit the photon at any time, and we can predict only a probability for emission; we cannot predict the future exactly.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I'm really looking forward to seeing what life brings to me.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I don't do things for the response or for the controversy. I just live my life.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: When you realize who you live for, and who's important to please, a lot of people will actually start living. I am never going to get caught up in that. I'm gonna look back on my life and say that I enjoyed it - and I lived it for me.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I always believed that when you follow your heart or your gut, when you really follow the things that feel great to you, you can never lose, because settling is the worst feeling in the world.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: The bottom line is that everyone thinks differently.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: When I am putting looks together, I dare myself to make something work. I always look for the most interesting silhouette or something that's a little off, but I have to figure it out. I have to make it me. I think that's the thrill in fashion.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: God just has a way of working things out the way he wants to and you have no say in that.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I'm crazy and I don't pretend to be anything else.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: If someone is right for you, you'll know it.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: My mother would kill me if I posed nude! My mother raised me with certain standards.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I am happy and I'm single.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: Single life is so overrated.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: You have to just accept your body. You may not love it all the way, but you just have to be comfortable with it, comfortable with knowing that that's your body.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I take risks because I get bored. And I get bored very easily.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: People take the little bit of information they're fed, and they draw a picture of who you are. Most of the time, it's wrong.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: If you don't live your life, then who will?

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: When I see myself as an old woman, I just think about being happy. And hopefully, I'll still be fly.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: Over the holidays, and even during filming, I realized that I actually like my body, even if it's not perfect according to the book. I just feel sexy. For the first time, I don't want to get rid of the curves. I just want to tone it up. My body is comfortable, and it's not unhealthy, so I'm going to rock with it.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I could never identify with that word, 'weak.'

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: You don't want to live your life and then meet someone. You want to share your life with someone. That's what I'm missing right now.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: If I cry, it's because I'm very angry and I can't do anything about it because I've run into a dead end. That's when the tears would come down.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: People think, because we're young, we aren't complex, but that's not true. We deal with life and love and broken hearts in the same way a woman a few years older might.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I have a lot of other stuff to accomplish before I get to kids. Whenever the time is right, I'll just know. If I had a girl, she'd probably be really rebellious. She would be like a bundle of karma. I would love to bring them up in Barbados.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I drink a lot of coconut water. It balances out all the other toxic stuff I put into my body.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: Whatever I'm feeling, whatever I'm going through, whatever mood I'm in... If I'm feeling like dancing or clubbing, then it will be reflected in the music. If I'm feeling dark and vulnerable, then it will reflect in the music, too.

author: Rihanna
authorOccupation: Singer, songwriter, fashion designer, model, actress
content: I know that a large part of my fan base is gay. They've shown me love from the start. I mean in this industry, everyone from my glam people to my dancers are gay. You can't be homophobic in this line of work - I'm a pop star!

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: May you live as long as you wish and love as long as you live.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Yield to temptation. It may not pass your way again.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Political tags - such as royalist, communist, democrat, populist, fascist, liberal, conservative, and so forth - are never basic criteria. The human race divides politically into those who want people to be controlled and those who have no such desire.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: I never learned from a man who agreed with me.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: The universe never did make sense; I suspect it was built on government contract.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: An armed society is a polite society. Manners are good when one may have to back up his acts with his life.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: By cultivating the beautiful we scatter the seeds of heavenly flowers, as by doing good we cultivate those that belong to humanity.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Never underestimate the power of human stupidity.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: One of the sanest, surest, and most generous joys of life comes from being happy over the good fortune of others.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do. I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them; if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own... Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: When a place gets crowded enough to require ID's, social collapse is not far away. It is time to go elsewhere. The best thing about space travel is that it made it possible to go elsewhere.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Anyone who considers protocol unimportant has never dealt with a cat.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: They didn't want it good, they wanted it Wednesday.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Everything is theoretically impossible, until it is done.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Don't handicap your children by making their lives easy.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: You can have peace. Or you can have freedom. Don't ever count on having both at once.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Be wary of strong drink. It can make you shoot at tax collectors... and miss.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: There is no way that writers can be tamed and rendered civilized or even cured. The only solution known to science is to provide the patient with an isolation room, where he can endure the acute stages in private and where food can be poked in to him with a stick.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: For me, politeness is a sine qua non of civilization.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Don't ever become a pessimist... a pessimist is correct oftener than an optimist, but an optimist has more fun, and neither can stop the march of events.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: When any government, or any church for that matter, undertakes to say to its subjects, This you may not read, this you must not see, this you are forbidden to know, the end result is tyranny and oppression no matter how holy the motives.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: Theology is never any help; it is searching in a dark cellar at midnight for a black cat that isn't there. Theologians can persuade themselves of anything.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
authorOccupation: Novelist, short story author, essayist, screenwriter, aeronautical engineer, lieutenant junior grade USN[1]
content: No statement should be believed because it is made by an authority.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Juvenile crime is not naturally born in the boy, but is largely due either to the spirit of adventure that is in him, to his own stupidity, or to his lack of discipline, according to the nature of the individual.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: I believe that God put us in this jolly world to be happy and enjoy life.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: We never fail when we try to do our duty, we always fail when we neglect to do it.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: A Scout smiles and whistles under all circumstances.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Be Prepared... the meaning of the motto is that a scout must prepare himself by previous thinking out and practicing how to act on any accident or emergency so that he is never taken by surprise.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: A Scout is never taken by surprise; he knows exactly what to do when anything unexpected happens.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: The most worth-while thing is to try to put happiness into the lives of others.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Happiness doesn't come from being rich, nor merely from being successful in your career, nor by self-indulgence. One step towards happiness is to make yourself healthy and strong while you are a boy so that you can be useful and so you can enjoy life when you are a man.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: An individual step in character training is to put responsibility on the individual.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Trust should be the basis for all our moral training.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Scoutcraft is a means through which the veriest hooligan can be brought to higher thought and to the elements of faith in God; and, coupled with the Scout's obligation to do a good turn every day, it gives the base of Duty to God and to Neighbour on which the parent or pastor can build with greater ease the form of belief that is desired.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: The spirit is there in every boy; it has to be discovered and brought to light.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: There are thousands of boys being wasted daily to our country through being left to become characterless, and, therefore, useless wasters, a misery to themselves and an eyesore and a danger to the nation. They could be saved if only the right surroundings or environment were given to them at the receptive time of their lives.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Nature study will show you how full of beautiful and wonderful things God has made the world for you to enjoy. Be contented with what you have got and make the best of it. Look on the bright side of things instead of the gloomy one.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Erudition - that is, reading, writing, and arithmetic - is taught in the schools; but where is the more important quality, character, taught? Nowhere in particular. There is no authorized training for children in character.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: If you make yourself indispensable to your employer, he is not going to part with you in a hurry no matter what it costs him.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Show me a poorly uniformed troop and I'll show you a poorly uniformed leader.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: If you are in the country, you should notice landmarks - that is, objects which help you to find your way or prevent you getting lost, such as distant hills, church towers, and nearer objects, such as peculiar buildings, trees, gates, rocks, etc.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Happiness is within the reach of everyone, rich or poor. Yet comparatively few people are happy. I believe the reason for this is that the majority don't recognize happiness even when it is within their grasp.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Success in training the boy depends largely on the Scoutmaster's own personal example.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: The more responsibility the Scoutmaster gives his patrol leaders, the more they will respond.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: To get a hold on boys you must be their friend.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: It always seems to me so odd that when a man dies, he takes out with him all the knowledge that he has got in his lifetime whilst sowing his wild oats or winning successes. And he leaves his sons or younger brothers to go through all the work of learning it over again from their own experience.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: A good boxing competition gives one the sight of fine men in their prime, trained to the ounce, showing the highest skill, pluck and endurance in carrying out their attack and defence under strict rules of fair play and good temper.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Life would pall if it were all sugar; salt is bitter if taken by itself; but when tasted as part of the dish, it savours the meat. Difficulties are the salt of life.

author: Robert Baden-Powell
authorOccupation: British Army officer, writer, author of Scouting for Boys
content: Try and leave this world a little better than you found it, and when your turn comes to die, you can die happy in feeling that at any rate, you have not wasted your time but have done your best.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: In this enlightened age, there are few I believe, but what will acknowledge, that slavery as an institution is a moral & political evil in any country. It is useless to expatiate on its disadvantages.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or to keep one.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: Obedience to lawful authority is the foundation of manly character.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: What a cruel thing war is... to fill our hearts with hatred instead of love for our neighbors.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: It is good that war is so horrible, or we might grow to like it.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: A Union that can only be maintained by swords and bayonets has no charm for me. If the Union is dissolved and government disrupted, I shall return to my native state and share the miseries of my people, and save in defense will draw my sword on none.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: I have fought against the people of the North because I believed they were seeking to wrest from the South its dearest rights. But I have never cherished toward them bitter or vindictive feelings, and I have never seen the day when I did not pray for them.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: The education of a man is never completed until he dies.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: We failed, but in the good providence of God apparent failure often proves a blessing.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: I like whiskey. I always did, and that is why I never drink it.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: Get correct views of life, and learn to see the world in its true light. It will enable you to live pleasantly, to do good, and, when summoned away, to leave without regret.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: The war... was an unnecessary condition of affairs, and might have been avoided if forebearance and wisdom had been practiced on both sides.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: If you have any fault to find with anyone, tell him, not others, of what you complain; there is no more dangerous experiment than that of undertaking to be one thing before a man's face and another behind his back.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: It is well that war is so terrible, otherwise we should grow too fond of it.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: We should live, act, and say nothing to the injury of anyone. It is not only best as a matter of principle, but it is the path to peace and honor.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: I tremble for my country when I hear of confidence expressed in me. I know too well my weakness, that our only hope is in God.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: While we see the course of the final abolition of human slavery is onward, & we give it the aid of our prayers & all justifiable means in our power, we must leave the progress as well as the result in his hands who sees the end; who chooses to work by slow influences; & with whom two thousand years are but as a single day.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: We must expect reverses, even defeats. They are sent to teach us wisdom and prudence, to call forth greater energies, and to prevent our falling into greater disasters.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: In all my perplexities and distresses, the Bible has never failed to give me light and strength.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: We have fought this fight as long, and as well as we know how. We have been defeated. For us as a Christian people, there is now but one course to pursue. We must accept the situation.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: I have been up to see the Congress and they do not seem to be able to do anything except to eat peanuts and chew tobacco, while my army is starving.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: I think it better to do right, even if we suffer in so doing, than to incur the reproach of our consciences and posterity.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: I cannot trust a man to control others who cannot control himself.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: Do your duty in all things, like the old Puritan. You cannot do more; you should never wish to do less.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: A true man of honor feels humbled himself when he cannot help humbling others.

author: Robert E. Lee
authorOccupation: Commander of the Confederate States Army
content: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or keep one; the man who requires you to do so is dearly purchased at a sacrifice.

author: Robert Frost
content: The woods are lovely, dark and deep. But I have promises to keep, and miles to go before I sleep.

author: Robert Frost
content: Poetry is when an emotion has found its thought and the thought has found words.

author: Robert Frost
content: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.

author: Robert Frost
content: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.

author: Robert Frost
content: Forgive me my nonsense, as I also forgive the nonsense of those that think they talk sense.

author: Robert Frost
content: The best way out is always through.

author: Robert Frost
content: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.

author: Robert Frost
content: Don't ever take a fence down until you know why it was put up.

author: Robert Frost
content: A bank is a place where they lend you an umbrella in fair weather and ask for it back when it begins to rain.

author: Robert Frost
content: Nothing can make injustice just but mercy.

author: Robert Frost

author: Tariq Ramadan
content: The philosophy of fasting calls upon us to know ourselves, to master ourselves, and to discipline ourselves the better to free ourselves. To fast is to identify our dependencies, and free ourselves from them.

content: Ramadan is, in its essence, a month of humanist spirituality.

author: Tariq Ramadan
content: Fasting is, first and foremost, an exercise for identifying and managing adversity in all its forms. With faith, in full conscience, fasting calls women and men to an extra degree of self-awareness.

author: Temple Grandin
authorOccupation: Professor of animal science at Colorado State University, consultant

author: Temple Grandin

author: Thich Nhat Hanh

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: We humans have lost the wisdom of genuinely resting and relaxing. We worry too much. We don't allow our bodies to heal, and we don't allow our minds and hearts to heal.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: If you truly get in touch with a piece of carrot, you get in touch with the soil, the rain, the sunshine. You get in touch with Mother Earth and eating in such a way, you feel in touch with true life, your roots, and that is meditation. If we chew every morsel of our food in that way we become grateful and when you are grateful, you are happy.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: You carry Mother Earth within you. She is not outside of you. Mother Earth is not just your environment. In that insight of inter-being, it is possible to have real communication with the Earth, which is the highest form of prayer.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: If we are peaceful, if we are happy, we can smile, and everyone in our family, our entire society, will benefit from our peace.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: True self is non-self, the awareness that the self is made only of non-self elements. There's no separation between self and other, and everything is interconnected. Once you are aware of that you are no longer caught in the idea that you are a separate entity.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: Meditation can help us embrace our worries, our fear, our anger; and that is very healing. We let our own natural capacity of healing do the work.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: To meditate means to go home to yourself. Then you know how to take care of the things that are happening inside you, and you know how to take care of the things that happen around you.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: When we recognise the virtues, the talent, the beauty of Mother Earth, something is born in us, some kind of connection, love is born.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: People have a hard time letting go of their suffering. Out of a fear of the unknown, they prefer suffering that is familiar.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: Every breath we take, every step we make, can be filled with peace, joy and serenity.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: Let us fill our hearts with our own compassion - towards ourselves and towards all living beings.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: Changing is not just changing the things outside of us. First of all we need the right view that transcends all notions including of being and non-being, creator and creature, mind and spirit. That kind of insight is crucial for transformation and healing.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: We will be more successful in all our endeavors if we can let go of the habit of running all the time, and take little pauses to relax and re-center ourselves. And we'll also have a lot more joy in living.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: Many people are alive but don't touch the miracle of being alive.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh

author: Thich Nhat Hanh

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: It's very important that we re-learn the art of resting and relaxing. Not only does it help prevent the onset of many illnesses that develop through chronic tension and worrying; it allows us to clear our minds, focus, and find creative solutions to problems.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: We need enlightenment, not just individually but collectively, to save the planet. We need to awaken ourselves. We need to practice mindfulness if we want to have a future, if we want to save ourselves and the planet.

content: When you look at the sun during your walking meditation, the mindfulness of the body helps you to see that the sun is in you; without the sun there is no life at all and suddenly you get in touch with the sun in a different way.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: Fearlessness is not only possible, it is the ultimate joy. When you touch nonfear, you are free.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: You practice mindfulness, on the one hand, to be calm and peaceful. On the other hand, as you practice mindfulness and live a life of peace, you inspire hope for a future of peace.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: Breathe in deeply to bring your mind home to your body. Then look at, or think of, the person triggering this emotion: With mindfulness, you can see that she is unhappy, that she is suffering. You can see her wrong perceptions. You can see that she is not beautiful when she says things that are unkind.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: You are a child of the sun, you come from the sun, and that is something true with the Earth also... your relationship with the Earth is so deep, and the Earth is in you and this is something not very difficult, much less difficult then philosophy.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: Most of us experience a life full of wonderful moments and difficult moments. But for many of us, even when we are most joyful, there is fear behind our joy.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
content: You know that your happiness and suffering depend on the happiness and suffering of others. That insight helps you not to do wrong things that will bring suffering to yourself and to other people.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

content: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: There is no substitute for hard work.

content: Being busy does not always mean real work. The object of all work is production or accomplishment and to either of these ends there must be forethought, system, planning, intelligence, and honest purpose, as well as perspiration. Seeming to do is not doing.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: There's a way to do it better - find it.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: The three great essentials to achieve anything worth while are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: I never did a day's work in my life. It was all fun.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: The chief function of the body is to carry the brain around.

author: Thomas A. Edison

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: What you are will show in what you do.

content: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: I find my greatest pleasure, and so my reward, in the work that precedes what the world calls success.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: To have a great idea, have a lot of them.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Discontent is the first necessity of progress.

author: Thomas A. Edison

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: I start where the last man left off.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: Religion is all bunk.

author: Thomas A. Edison
content: The value of an idea lies in the using of it.

content: The secret thoughts of a man run over all things, holy, profane, clean, obscene, grave, and light, without shame or blame.

content: When angry count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.

author: Thomas Merton

content: Perhaps I am stronger than I think.

content: The tighter you squeeze, the less you have.

author: Vince Lombardi

author: Vince Lombardi

author: Vincent Van Gogh
content: Conscience is a man's compass.

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor
content: Education must not simply teach work - it must teach Life.

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor
content: A system of education is not one thing, nor does it have a single definite object, nor is it a mere matter of schools. Education is that whole system of human training within and without the school house walls, which molds and develops men.

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor
content: Education is that whole system of human training within and without the school house walls, which molds and develops men.

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor
content: The Negro race, like all races, is going to be saved by its exceptional men. The problem of education, then, among Negroes must first of all deal with the Talented Tenth; it is the problem of developing the Best of this race that they may guide the Mass away from the contamination and death of the Worst, in their own and other races.

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor
content: Education is the development of power and ideal.

authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor
content: When you have mastered numbers, you will in fact no longer be reading numbers, any more than you read words when reading books You will be reading meanings.

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

author: W. E. B. Du Bois

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor
content: A classic is a book that doesn't have to be written again.

content: Believe in life! Always human beings will live and progress to greater, broader, and fuller life.

authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor
content: Before and after emancipation, the Negro, in self-defense, was propelled toward the white employer. author: W. E. B. Du Bois
authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

I do not care a damn for any art that is not used for propaganda.

authorOccupation: Sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, writer, editor

author: W. E. B. Du Bois

author: W. E. B. Du Bois

content: I had a happy childhood and acceptance in the community.

author: W. E. B. Du Bois

author: W. E. B. Du Bois

content: For the Negro, Andrew Johnson did less than nothing when once he realized that the chief beneficiary of labor and economic reform in the South would be freedmen. author: W. E. B. Du Bois
